alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued March 23 at 11:23AM AKDT until March 24 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 45 below to 50 below zero. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Now to 7 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty east winds will develop Wednesday afternoon with blowing snow reducing visibility to less than one mile at times. Expect difficult travel conditions. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
